      • getBigInteger

      • toBytes

        public static byte[] toBytes(java.math.BigInteger v)
        Convert a BigInteger to a standard byte[] format. Outputs four bytes of length (big-endian), followed by that many bytes of big-endian data. Leading 0 bytes are removed, and the data is always treated as unsigned.

      • toTrimmedBytes

        public static byte[] toTrimmedBytes(java.math.BigInteger v)

      • toOutBuf

        public static void toOutBuf(java.math.BigInteger v,
            OutBuf ob)
                     throws OTRException
        Throws:
        OTRException

      • fromBytes

        public static java.math.BigInteger fromBytes(byte[] input)
        Converts the byte array to a BigInteger object. The first 4 bytes indicate the length of the rest of the data. The length as well as the actual value of the BigInteger object is interpreted as big-endian.
        Returns:
        a BigInteger containing the value as specified by input.

      • fromTrimmedBytes

        public static java.math.BigInteger fromTrimmedBytes(byte[] input)

      • fromInBuf

        public static java.math.BigInteger fromInBuf(InBuf input)
                                      throws OTRException
        Read a BigInteger object from InBuf. The first 4 bytes indicate the length of the rest of the data. The length as well as the actual value of the BigInteger object is interpreted as big-endian.
        Returns:
        a BigInteger containing the value as specified by input.
        Throws:
        OTRException
